clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparison of the Ambu AuraGain Versus LMA Supreme in Children
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Comparison of the Ambu AuraGain™ and LMA Supreme™ in Infants and Children

lead_sponsor.agency: Ann & Robert H Lurie Children's Hospital of Chicago

clinical_study.source: Ann & Robert H Lurie Children's Hospital of Chicago

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether there is a clinically relevant difference in airway leak pressures between the Ambu AuraGain and the Laryngeal Mask Airway (LMA) Supreme.

detailed_description.textblock: The goal of this prospective randomized study is to compare whether there is a clinically relevant difference in airway leak pressures between the Ambu AuraGain (sizes 1.5 and 2) and the Laryngeal Mask Airway (LMA) Supreme. Parameters of clinical relevance such as insertion success rates, fiberoptic view of the glottic opening, ease and speed of gastric tube placement, airway stability, and peri-operative complications will also be assessed.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed intraoperatively at the time of confirmed device placement
primary_outcome.description: The airway pressure at which an airway leak is observed after successful placement of the supraglottic airway

primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed intraoperatively, 10 minutes after the initial confirmed placement of the device
primary_outcome.description: The airway pressure at which an airway leak is observed 10 minutes after successful placement of the supraglottic airway

secondary_outcome.measure: Time for Successful Placement of the Supraglottic Airway
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed intraoperatively at the time of confirmed device placement
secondary_outcome.description: Time for successful placement of supraglottic device will be recorded

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of attempts to placement of Supraglottic Airway
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed intraoperatively at the time of confirmed device placement
secondary_outcome.description: Number of attempts and insertion techniques will be recorded (maximum of 3 attempts)

secondary_outcome.measure: Fiberoptic Grade of Laryngeal View through Supraglottic Airway
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed intraoperatively at the time of confirmed device placement
secondary_outcome.description: Fiberoptic Grade of Laryngeal View through either device will be graded using a previously published grading system

secondary_outcome.measure: Gastric Tube Insertion Ease of Placement
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed intraoperatively at the time of confirmed gastric tube placement
secondary_outcome.description: The ease of placement, based on a 1-4 scale, will be recorded following placement and confirmation of the gastric tube.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed intraoperatively at the time of confirmed gastric tube placement
secondary_outcome.description: The elapsed time from beginning insertion of the gastric tube to confirmation, will be recorded. Confirmation of gastric tube placement will be determined by injection of air with auscultation (listening for sounds) over the stomach with a stethoscope.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed intraoperatively at the time of confirmed gastric tube placement
secondary_outcome.description: Number of insertion attempts of the gastric tube through the SGA will be recorded. Confirmation of gastric tube placement will be determined by injection of air with auscultation (listening for sounds) over the stomach with a stethoscope.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay. Outcome measure will be assessed postoperatively in recovery unit.
secondary_outcome.description: Patient will be evaluated for sore throat, cough, dysphonia, stridor, or other airway related complications during the post-operative period.
Complications such as reflex activation of the airway (coughing, breath holding, laryngospasm, bronchospasm), oxygen desaturation will be recorded, if they occur.

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive the Ambu AuraGain size 1.5 or 2.0 based on manufacturer guidelines
Subjects will receive the Ambu AuraGain size 1.5 or 2.0 based on manufacturer guidelines

intervention.description: The device will be inserted and timed. A leak pressure test will be performed after successful insertion and after 10 minutes. The larynx will be visualized by placing a fiberoptic bronchoscope through the device. A gastric tube will be inserted through the device and timed.

The device will be inserted and timed. A leak pressure test will be performed after successful insertion and after 10 minutes. The larynx will be visualized by placing a fiberoptic bronchoscope through the device. A gastric tube will be inserted through the device and timed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Scheduled for surgery utilizing a supraglottic airway device
- ASA (American Society of Anesthesiologists) I-III classification
- Weighing between 5 - 20 kilograms
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active respiratory infection
- History of difficult mask ventilation
- Diagnosis of congenital syndrome with difficult airway management
- Active gastrointestinal reflux
- Coagulopathy
- Significant Pulmonary disease
- Emergent surgery
